intro: [WRONG START] Walenia sylvestris, commonly known as the forest wallenia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Wallenia sylvestris thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a common sight in woodland understories. Its foliage and flowers attract a variety of pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in natural habitats.
